repoURL.description: Repository url from which the Helm chart should be obtained

values.description: Helm values of the chart, allows overriding defaults and setting values that are not exposed as explicit configuration

version.description: The version of the Helm chart to be installed

baseUrl.description: the external base url (TLD) for all tools, e.g. https://example.com or http://localhost:8080. The individual -url params for argocd, grafana, vault and mailhog take precedence.

clusterAdmin.description: Binds ArgoCD controllers to cluster-admin ClusterRole

gitEmail.description: Sets git author and committer email used for initial commits

gitName.description: Sets git author and committer name used for initial commits

insecure.description: Sets insecure-mode in cURL which skips cert validation

mirrorRepos.description: Changes the sources of deployed tools so they are not pulled from the internet, but are pulled from git and work in air-gapped environments.

namePrefix.description: Set name-prefix for repos, jobs, namespaces

namespaceIsolation.description: Configure tools to explicitly work with the given namespaces only, and not cluster-wide. This way GOP can be installed without having cluster-admin permissions.

openshift.description: When set, openshift specific resources and configurations are applied

podResources.description: Write kubernetes resource requests and limits on each pod

skipCrds.description: Skip installation of CRDs. This requires prior installation of CRDs

urlSeparatorHyphen.description: Use hyphens instead of dots to separate application name from base-url

allowedStaticsWhitelist.description: Whitelist for Statics freemarker is allowing in user templates

examples.description: Deploy example content: source repos, GitOps repos, Jenkins Job, Argo CD apps/project

multitenancyExamples.description: Deploy multi tenancy example content: source repos, GitOps repos, Jenkins Job, Argo CD apps/project

namespaces.description: Additional kubernetes namespaces. These are authorized to Argo CD, supplied with image pull secrets, monitored by prometheus, etc. Namespaces can be templates, e.g. ${config.application.namePrefix}staging

repos.description: ContentLoader repos to push into target environment

createJenkinsJob.description: If true, creates a Jenkins job, if jenkinsfile exists in one of the content repo's branches.

passwordKey.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

secretName.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

secretNamespace.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

username.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

usernameKey.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

credentials.description: Credentials Object to authenticate against content repo. Allows using a K8s Secret

overwriteMode.description:
This defines, how customer repos will be updated.
INIT - push only if repo does not exist.
RESET - delete all files after cloning source - files not in content are deleted
UPGRADE - clone and copy - existing files will be overwritten, files not in content are kept. For type: MIRROR reset and upgrade have same result: in both cases source repo will be force pushed to target repo.

path.description: Path within the content repo to process

ref.description: Reference for a specific branch, tag, or commit. Emtpy defaults to default branch of the repo. With type MIRROR: ref must not be a commit hash; Choosing a ref only mirrors the ref but does not delete other branches/tags!

target.description: Target repo for the repository in the for of namespace/name. Must contain one slash to separate namespace from name.

targetRef.description: Reference for a specific branch or tag in the target repo of a MIRROR or COPY repo. If ref is a tag, targetRef is treated as tag as well. Except: targetRef is full ref like refs/heads/my-branch or refs/tags/my-tag. Empty defaults to the source ref.

templating.description: When true, template all files ending in .ftl within the repo

type.description:
ContentLoader Repos can either be:
copied (only the files, starting on ref, starting at path within the repo. Requires target)
, mirrored (FORCE pushes ref or the whole git repo if no ref set). Requires target, does not allow path and template.)
folderBased (folder structure is interpreted as repos. That is, root folder becomes namespace in SCM, sub folders become repository names in SCM, files are copied. Requires target.)

url.description: URL of the content repo. Mandatory for each type.

useWhitelist.description: Enables the whitelist for statics in content templating

variables.description: Additional variables to use in custom templates.

content.description: Config parameters for content, i.e. end-user or tenant applications as opposed to cluster-resources

emailFrom.description: Notifications, define Argo CD sender email address

emailToAdmin.description: Notifications, define Argo CD admin recipient email address

emailToUser.description: Notifications, define Argo CD user / app-team recipient email address

env.description: Pass a list of env vars to Argo CD components. Currently only works with operator

namespace.description: Defines the kubernetes namespace for ArgoCD

operator.description: Install ArgoCD via an already running ArgoCD Operator

resourceInclusionsCluster.description: Internal Kubernetes API Server URL https://IP:PORT (kubernetes.default.svc). Needed in argocd-operator resourceInclusions. Use this parameter if argocd.operator=true and NOT running inside a Pod (remote mode). Full URL needed, for example: https://100.125.0.1:443

url.description: The URL where argocd is accessible. It has to be the full URL with http:// or https://

values.description: Helm values of the chart, allows overriding defaults and setting values that are not exposed as explicit configuration

argocd.description: Config Parameter for the ArgoCD Operator

acmeSolverImage.description: Sets acmeSolver Image for Cert Manager

cainjectorImage.description: Sets cainjector Image for Cert Manager

repoURL.description: Repository url from which the Helm chart should be obtained

startupAPICheckImage.description: Sets startupAPICheck Image for Cert Manager

values.description: Helm values of the chart, allows overriding defaults and setting values that are not exposed as explicit configuration

version.description: The version of the Helm chart to be installed

webhookImage.description: Sets webhook Image for Cert Manager

helm.description: Common Config parameters for the Helm package manager: Name of Chart (chart), URl of Helm-Repository (repoURL) and Chart Version (version). Note: These config is intended to obtain the chart from a different source (e.g. in air-gapped envs), not to use a different version of a helm chart. Using a different helm chart or version to the one used in the GOP version will likely cause errors.

certManager.description: Config parameters for the Cert Manager

mailUrl.description: Sets url for the mail server frontend

smtpAddress.description: Sets smtp port of external Mailserver

smtpPassword.description: Sets smtp password of external Mailserver

smtpPort.description: Sets smtp port of external Mailserver

smtpUser.description: Sets smtp username for external Mailserver

active.description: Installs the Kube-Prometheus-Stack. This includes Prometheus, the Prometheus operator, Grafana and some extra resources

grafanaEmailFrom.description: Notifications, define grafana alerts sender email address

grafanaEmailTo.description: Notifications, define grafana alerts recipient email address

certControllerImage.description: Sets image for external secrets operator's controller

externalSecrets.description: Config parameters for the external secrets operator

mode.description: Installs Hashicorp vault and the external secrets operator. Possible values: dev, prod.

secrets.description: Config parameters for the secrets management

features.description: Config parameters for features or tools

helm.description: Common Config parameters for the Helm package manager: Name of Chart (chart), URl of Helm-Repository (repoURL) and Chart Version (version). Note: These config is intended to obtain the chart from a different source (e.g. in air-gapped envs), not to use a different version of a helm chart. Using a different helm chart or version to the one used in the GOP version will likely cause errors.

mavenCentralMirror.description: URL for maven mirror, used by applications built in Jenkins

metricsPassword.description: Mandatory when jenkins-url is set and monitoring enabled

metricsUsername.description: Mandatory when jenkins-url is set and monitoring enabled

skipPlugins.description: Skips plugin installation. Use with caution! If the plugins are not installed up front, the installation will likely fail. The intended use case for this is after the first installation, for config changes only. Do not use on first installation or upgrades.

skipRestart.description: Skips restarting Jenkins after plugin installation. Use with caution! If the plugins are not installed up front, the installation will likely fail. The intended use case for this is after the first installation, for config changes only. Do not use on first installation or upgrades.

url.description: The url of your external jenkins

jenkins.description: Config parameters for Jenkins CI/CD Pipeline Server

parentGroupId.description: Main Group for Gitlab where the GOP creates it's groups/repos

username.description: GitLab username for API access. Must be 'oauth2' when using Personal Access Token (PAT) authentication

internal.description: SCM for Central Management is running on the same cluster, so k8s internal URLs can be used for access

namespace.description: Namespace where to find the Central SCMM

rootPath.description: Root path for SCM Manager. In SCM-Manager it is always "repo"

url.description: URL for the centralized Management Repo

scmProviderType.description: The SCM provider type. Possible values: SCM_MANAGER, GITLAB

useDedicatedInstance.description: Toggles the Dedicated Instances Mode. See docs for more info

active.description: Installs a simple cluster-local registry for demonstration purposes. Warning: Registry does not provide authentication!

createImagePullSecrets.description: Create image pull secrets for registry and proxy-registry for all GOP namespaces and helm charts. Uses proxy-username, read-only-username or registry-username (in this order).  Use this if your cluster is not auto-provisioned with credentials for your private registries or if you configure individual helm images to be pulled from the proxy-registry that requires authentication.

helm.description: Common Config parameters for the Helm package manager: Name of Chart (chart), URl of Helm-Repository (repoURL) and Chart Version (version). Note: These config is intended to obtain the chart from a different source (e.g. in air-gapped envs), not to use a different version of a helm chart. Using a different helm chart or version to the one used in the GOP version will likely cause errors.

internalPort.description: Port of registry registry. Ignored when a registry*url params are set

proxyPassword.description: Use with registry-proxy-url, added to Jenkins as credentials and created as pull secrets, when create-image-pull-secrets is set.

proxyUrl.description: The url of your proxy-registry. Used in pipelines to authorize pull base images. Use in conjunction with petclinic base image. Used in helm charts when create-image-pull-secrets is set. Use in conjunction with helm.*image fields.

proxyUsername.description: Use with registry-proxy-url, added to Jenkins as credentials and created as pull secrets, when create-image-pull-secrets is set.

readOnlyPassword.description: Optional alternative password for registry-url with read-only permissions that is used when create-image-pull-secrets is set.

readOnlyUsername.description: Optional alternative username for registry-url with read-only permissions that is used when create-image-pull-secrets is set.

url.description: The url of your external registry, used for pushing images

internal.description: True if Gitlab is running in the same K8s cluster. For now we only support access by external URL

parentGroupId.description: Number for the Gitlab Group where the repos and subgroups should be created

password.description: PAT Token for the account. Needs read/write repo permissions. See docs for mor information

url.description: Base URL for the Gitlab instance

username.description: Defaults to: oauth2.0 when PAT token is given.

helm.description: Common Config parameters for the Helm package manager: Name of Chart (chart), URl of Helm-Repository (repoURL) and Chart Version (version). Note: These config is intended to obtain the chart from a different source (e.g. in air-gapped envs), not to use a different version of a helm chart. Using a different helm chart or version to the one used in the GOP version will likely cause errors.

rootPath.description: Sets the root path for the Git Repositories. In SCM-Manager it is always "repo"

skipPlugins.description: Skips plugin installation. Use with caution! If the plugins are not installed up front, the installation will likely fail. The intended use case for this is after the first installation, for config changes only. Do not use on first installation or upgrades.

skipRestart.description: Skips restarting SCM-Manager after plugin installation. Use with caution! If the plugins are not installed up front, the installation will likely fail. The intended use case for this is after the first installation, for config changes only. Do not use on first installation or upgrades.'

url.description: The host of your external scm-manager

scmProviderType.description: The SCM provider type. Possible values: SCM_MANAGER, GITLAB
